STBLKeyStringList.Text: (From Good Manner Trait and Being Gross)
{0.SimFirstName} has spread some juicy gossip about {1.SimFirstName}
(From Learning to Say Please and Thank You)
(From Waking Up Near a Night Light)
{0.SimFirstName} is going through a phase. {M0.He}{F0.She}'s found a spirit animal. {0.SimFirstName} will only want to wear {M0.his}{F0.her} Bear suit.
{0.SimFirstName} has entered the Picky Eater phase.
{0.SimFirstName} is going through a phase. {M0.He}{F0.She} will pick up an instrument any chance {M0.he}{F0.she} gets, yell often, and turn all radios up to eleven!
{0.SimFirstName} is going through a phase. {M0.He}{F0.She}'s having a bit of a Mean Streak and feels like being more nasty with other Sims.
{0.SimFirstName} is going through a phase. {M0.He}{F0.She}'s feeling a bit Clingy and is going to stay extra close to {M0.his}{F0.her} favorite caregiver.
{0.SimFirstName} is going through a phase. {M0.He}{F0.She}'s feeling Distant and will prefer to be alone for a while.
{0.SimFirstName} is going through a phase. {M0.He}{F0.She} is feeling very Rebellious and will seek to challenge parental authority.
I'm a Bear! There is nothing you can do to change that. Well, I guess you could talk to me about the costume. Maybe you could dress as a Bear as well?
Let me enjoy my Mean Streak! Disciplining my actions will make me behave. Do you really want to spoil my fun?
I'm getting Picky about the food I eat. You could Call me to Meals and Encourage me to Eat new foods but I won't promise I will like them.
The world needs to hear me! You can influence me to be quiet and discipline me over loud actions. Just know, the fire inside will never die.
I feel like I want to be alone. Jokes, volunteer events, or even playing Buildem Blocks with me may get me to come out of my shell.
It's my time to stand up to authority and be rebellious. A few good hugs or helping me with my homework could get me to soften my attitude.
I just want to be near my parents. A gentle nudging to play with other children, make friends, or even gain skills would help me to become more independent.
{1.SimFirstName} has sent {0.SimFirstName} a gift. Look for it arriving in the mail soon.
{0.SimFirstName} has returned home with a school project. Completing this project will grant school progress. Additional progress will be awarded if the project is completed quickly.
(From Completing A Poor Quality School Project)
{0.SimFirstName} finished {M0.his}{F0.her} school project quickly! Extra credit has been awarded!
Nice work, {0.SimFirstName}! Completing School projects really has a positive impact on your grades. Keep up the good work!
{0.SimFirstName} has received an Excellence Bunny Award in {M0.his}{F0.her} inventory!
(From Good Mannered Sim Shouting Forbidden Words)
{0.SimFirstName} made sure no one was looking, then tossed one of the cupcakes to the squirrel. The squirrel stuffed its cheeks with the cupcake and happily ran off.

{0.SimFirstName} saw through the squirrels ruse and spotted the group of squirrels hiding under the table and waiting to pounce on the unguarded cupcakes. After shooing the furry bandits, {0.SimFirstName} sold the full batch of cupcakes, making a nice profit for the charity.

{0.SimFirstName} chased after the squirrel while trying to shoo it away. While {0.SimFirstName} was distracted by anger at the greedy squirrel, another group of squirrels pounced on the unguarded cupcakes and took the whole batch. Sadly, there were none left to sell for the charity.
{0.SimName} lost some Emotional Control from letting {M0.his}{F0.her} anger at the annoying squirrel distract {M0.him}{F0.her}.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility from shooing the squirrels from the baked goods and selling all of them.

While {0.SimFirstName} tossed a cupcake to the squirrel, a gang of other squirrels stole the whole batch of cupcakes from the table. The volunteer coordinator was horrified by the cupcake carnage, and the bake sale wasn't able to raise enough money due to the loss of the cupcakes.
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility from letting the squirrels raid the bake sale.
{0.SimName} gained some Empathy from tossing a cupcake to the squirrel at the bake sale.

The Sim who baked the muffins came by and was shocked that {0.SimFirstName} had cut the tops off the muffins. {0.SimFirstName} was able to calm the Sim's nerves and showed the baker that the muffin tops were a great success!

{0.SimFirstName} decided that the muffin top idea is a non-starter. {M0.He}{F0.She} convinced the volunteer to work hard at selling full delicious muffins. Their teamwork paid off and the muffins were a big hit.

The volunteer won't be stopped and went ahead with selling the muffin tops. It was a huge success and {0.SimFirstName} was enraged that {M0.his}{F0.her} muffins didn't sell as well. \n\nOn top of that, the bake sale coordinator put {0.SimFirstName} in charge of dealing with all the uneaten muffin stumps. {0.SimFirstName} was so angry that {M0.he}{F0.she} tossed the muffin stumps at the other volunteer.
{0.SimName} lost some Emotional Control from having a tantrum at the muffin tops at the bake sale.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution and Social from working well with the other bake sale volunteer.

The Sim who baked the muffins came by and was enraged that {0.SimFirstName} had ruined the muffins. {0.SimFirstName} was unsuccessful in calming the baker's nerves, and the baker threw all the muffin tops in the trash!
{0.SimName} lost some Conflict Resolution from unsuccessfully convincing the baker to sell muffin tops.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution from convincing the baker to let {M0.him}{F0.her} sell the muffin tops.
That did it. The fear of baked goods with no milk chaser was keeping the crowds away. After {0.SimFirstName} set up the milk bar, the sales of baked goods began to rise.

{0.SimFirstName} found trending hashtags for {M0.his}{F0.her} scrumptious photos that appeal to Sims' hunger and sense of charity. Generous Sims start to arrive en masse and {0.SimFirstName} saved the event.

It looks like {0.SimFirstName} overestimated {M0.his}{F0.her} social presence. {M0.His}{F0.Her} posts only get two likes and no shares. The bake sale director scolds {0.SimFirstName} for playing on {M0.his}{F0.her} phone instead of working the bake sale.
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility from playing on {M0.his}{F0.her} phone when {M0.he}{F0.she} was supposed to be selling baked goods.
{0.SimName} gained some Empathy for figuring out how to appeal to Sims' sense of charity.
{0.SimFirstName} missed the note that this was a lactose free, gluten free, vegan bake sale. A number of gassy, upset Sims are demanding {0.SimFirstName} leave.
{0.SimName} lost some Empathy for forgetting the bake sale was a lactose free event!
{0.SimName} gained some Empathy for taking into account the thirsty Sims at the bake sale.

{0.SimFirstName} took charge of the bake sale and things started running smoothly. The baked goods were put on display, volunteers got clear direction, and a new queuing system was developed that will revolutionize standing in line around the world.

{0.SimFirstName} finds the coordinator trapped under a pile of meringue cookies. With super human strength, {0.SimFirstName} frees the coordinator from under the pile. This heroic act saves both the coordinator and the bake sale.

{0.SimFirstName} heads off into the park to search for the coordinator. Unfortunately, {M0.he}{F0.she} gets lost in the search and it is hours before {0.SimFirstName} finds {M0.his}{F0.her} way back to the bake sale. The other volunteers think {0.SimFirstName} shirked {M0.his}{F0.her} responsibilities while the others worked.
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility from shirking {M0.his}{F0.her} volunteer duties at the bake sale.
{0.SimName} gained some Empathy and Motor from freeing the coordinator from the mound of cookies.
{0.SimName} gained some Empathy and Fitness from freeing the coordinator from the mound of cookies.

The lack of experience leading a group of rough and tumble bake sale volunteers is apparent. {0.SimFirstName} tries and fails to win hearts and minds of the volunteers. The hungry crowd of Sims soon follow their noses to Hogan's Burger Shack.
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility for failing to rally the bake sale volunteers.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility and Logic from organizing the bake sale.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility and Mental from organizing the bake sale.

{0.SimFirstName} starts to reach for a macaroon, but {M0.he}{F0.she} realizes the bake sale might not reach its sales goal if {M0.he}{F0.she} steals them. {M0.He}{F0.She} puts some money in the donation pile and enjoys the coconut macaroons guilt-free.
Willpower wins out and {0.SimFirstName} made it through the whole bake sale without sneaking a snack.

An empty stomach combined with all the fantastic bake sale smells soon became too much. The other volunteers noticed {0.SimFirstName} staring longingly at the macaroons while drooling profusely. No customers approached {0.SimFirstName} for help and sales suffer.
{0.SimName} lost some Manners for drooling on {M0.himself}{F0.herself} over the bake sale cookies.
{0.SimName} gained some Manners from controlling {M0.his}{F0.her} desire to sneak a cookie during the bake sale.
The other volunteers noticed the missing macaroons. {0.SimFirstName} is forced to fess up after crumbs are found on {M0.his}{F0.her} clothes. {M0.He}{F0.She} is demoted to muffin stub disposal duty.
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility for eating all the macaroons {M0.he}{F0.she} was supposed to sell.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility from paying for the cookies that {M0.he}{F0.she} ate.
The owner was so happy to get their wallet back that {0.SimFirstName} got a big hug and a warm fuzzy feeling.

{0.SimFirstName} knew keeping the wallet wasn't the right thing to do, but the extra cash in {M0.his}{F0.her} pocket feels so good. The owner of the wallet is probably pretty upset that they didn't get their wallet back.

{0.SimFirstName} tried to stealthily slip the wallet into {M0.his}{F0.her} pocket, but {M0.he}{F0.she} got caught by the volunteer coordinator. The coordinator was really disappointed by {M0.his}{F0.her} behavior and forced {M0.him}{F0.her} to return the wallet.
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility from getting caught trying to pocket the wallet {M0.he}{F0.she} found on the beach.
{0.SimName} lost some Empathy but gained some Simoleons from keeping the wallet {M0.he}{F0.she} found at the beach.

{0.SimFirstName} tried to call the owner of the wallet, but they immediately accused {M0.him}{F0.her} of stealing the wallet! {0.SimFirstName} tried to explain {M0.himself}{F0.herself}, but {M0.he}{F0.she} finally got so frustrated that {M0.he}{F0.she} ended up hanging up the phone.
{0.SimName} lost some Empathy for not returning the wallet to its rightful owner.
{0.SimName} gained a lot of Responsibility for returning the wallet {M0.he}{F0.she} found on the beach.

{0.SimFirstName} gave the trash a swift kick, and it flew into the air and landed right in a trash can! All the volunteers started laughing including {0.SimFirstName}, and {M0.he}{F0.she} realized that {M0.he}{F0.she} felt better laughing at {M0.his}{F0.her} mistakes than acting out on them.
{0.SimFirstName} shook off {M0.his}{F0.her} embarrassment and picked up the trash again. The cute Sim came over to help and really made {0.SimFirstName}'s day!

{0.SimFirstName} picked up the trash again, walked a little further, and clumsily tripped again! {M0.He}{F0.She} gave up in frustration and left the trash all over the beach. The other volunteers had to clean up the mess instead.
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility from leaving trash scattered all over the beach.
{0.SimName} gained some Emotional Control and became Happy from picking up the trash {M0.he}{F0.she} dropped.
{0.SimFirstName} gave the trash a wild kick in a fit of anger, but immediately regretted {M0.his}{F0.her} decision when the trash flew and hit the cute Sim in the face!
{0.SimName} lost some Emotional Control from wildly kicking the trash during the beach cleanup.
{0.SimName} gained Emotional Control from laughing at {M0.his}{F0.her} clumsiness while cleaning up the beach.
{0.SimFirstName} tried to stop the argument, but one of the volunteers accidentally pushed {M0.him}{F0.her} to the ground! Everyone realized how silly the argument was and decided to shake hands.

{0.SimFirstName} didn't feel comfortable trying to break up the argument. To {M0.his}{F0.her} surprise, a young adult Sim stepped in and cooled down everyone's temper. {0.SimFirstName} got some good tips on how to resolve arguments by observing the young adult.
{0.SimFirstName} decided to mind {M0.his}{F0.her} own business and stay out of the argument. The argument escalated and some driftwood went flying and hit {0.SimFirstName} in the head!
{0.SimName} lost some Conflict Resolution from letting the argument escalate between Sims at the beach.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution from observing another Sim break up an argument at the beach.

{0.SimFirstName} tried to break up the argument, but it just made the arguing Sims angrier and they pulled {M0.him}{F0.her} into the argument. {M0.He}{F0.She} ended up spending a long time arguing in circles.
{0.SimName} lost some Conflict Resolution from getting pulled into the argument with the beach volunteers.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution from resolving the argument at the beach, but lost some Hygiene from falling in the sand!

{0.SimFirstName} continued to pick up trash instead of helping the struggling Sim. {M0.He}{F0.She} ended up picking up more trash than anyone else that day, but {M0.he}{F0.she} felt bad when {M0.he}{F0.she} noticed that the older Sim was all scraped and bruised.

{0.SimFirstName} rushed over to help the older Sim drag the large debris off the beach. The older Sim was really grateful for the help and the two of them spent some time working together to haul a lot of large debris off the beach. The beach looked a lot better when they were done!
{0.SimFirstName} tried to help the older Sim, but quickly lost {M0.his}{F0.her} temper with the large piece of debris and stormed off without finishing helping the other Sim.
{0.SimName} lost some Emotional Control from losing {M0.his}{F0.her} temper with the unwieldy debris at the beach.
{0.SimName} gained some Empathy from helping the older Sim with the debris on the beach.

{0.SimFirstName} ignored the struggling Sim and went back to picking up trash. Suddenly, {M0.he}{F0.she} heard a huge crash, and the older Sim was lying on his back struggling like a flipped turtle. {0.SimFirstName} couldn't help but laugh at the other Sim's misfortune.
{0.SimName} lost some Empathy and gained some Fun from laughing at the struggling Sim at the beach cleanup.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility from picking so much trash on the beach, but {M0.he}{F0.she} lost some Empathy from ignoring the struggling Sim.

Instead of engaging the bullies, {0.SimFirstName} started up some small talk with the bullied Sim. The bullies were frustrated that they couldn't engage {0.SimFirstName} and gave up on their taunting.
{0.SimFirstName} approached the bullies and calmly convinced them to leave the other Sim alone. The bullied Sim was really grateful and they had a really good time chatting.

{0.SimFirstName} approached the bullies, but {M0.he}{F0.she} didn't know what to say, so {M0.he}{F0.she} started yelling at the bullies. {M0.He}{F0.She} got into a huge fight with the bullies and finally the volunteer coordinator had to break it up.
{0.SimName} lost some Conflict Resolution for getting into an argument with the bullies.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution and Social from talking with the bullied Sim at the beach.
{0.SimFirstName} awkwardly approached the bullied Sim, but the Sim was convinced that {0.SimFirstName} was trying to bully him too and snapped at {M0.him}{F0.her}.
{0.SimName} lost some Empathy from bungling the conversation with the bullied Sim.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution from talking to the bullied Sim at the beach.
Volunteering is fun and builds character! It feels good to do things for others.

{0.SimFirstName} got a bit bored playing card games, but the elderly Sim was enthusiastic about sharing stories with {0.SimFirstName}. It seemed like {0.SimFirstName} really brightened the elder's day.

{0.SimFirstName} made up an excuse that {M0.he}{F0.she} was cleaning the common room. To keep up the ruse, {M0.he}{F0.she} spent a long time straightening up, but the room actually looked a lot better afterwards and the nursing house residents were pleased.

{0.SimFirstName} escaped from the elderly Sim by making a lame excuse, and spent some time socializing with the other volunteers. Later, {M0.he}{F0.she} noticed that the elderly Sim looked really lonely and sad.
{0.SimFirstName} lost some Empathy and gained some Social from socializing with other volunteers at the Nursing Home.
{0.SimFirstName} gained some Manners and lost some Hygiene from cleaning up the Nursing Home common room.

{0.SimFirstName} learned the card game quickly, and easily won a dozen matches against the elder. The elderly Sim looked like they weren't having a very good time. Maybe {0.SimFirstName} should have let the elder win a few times?
{0.SimName} lost some Empathy and gained some Logic from winning the card games against the elder.
{0.SimName} lost some Empathy and gained some Mental skill from winning cards against the Elder.
{0.SimFirstName} got some Empathy and became Bored from playing cards with the elder Sim at the Nursing Home.

{0.SimFirstName} patiently listened to the elderly Sim's stories and found that the elderly Sim had a lot of interesting adventures in his younger days. {M0.He}{F0.She} really enjoyed the conversation!

{0.SimFirstName} was dashing to the bathroom when {M0.he}{F0.she} almost tripped right over an elderly Sim in a wheelchair. {M0.He}{F0.She} stopped to make sure the elderly Sim was OK, and helped the elderly Sim get to the cafeteria. The elderly Sim thanked {M0.him}{F0.her} for being so helpful.
The elderly Sim looked really disappointed when {0.SimFirstName} ran away. {0.SimFirstName} was too embarrassed to face the elderly Sim and hid out in the bathroom for a long time.
{0.SimFirstName} lost some Empathy and became Embarrassed from hiding from the elderly Sim.
{0.SimFirstName} gained some Responsibility from helping the elderly Sim at the Nursing Home.

{0.SimFirstName} was trapped into a long conversation with the Elderly Sim and was so bored that {M0.he}{F0.she} fell asleep. When {M0.he}{F0.she} woke up, there was a note from the elderly Sim: "Didn't anyone ever teach you it's rude to nap when others are talking?"
{0.SimFirstName} lost some Manners and became Bored from falling asleep while talking with a Sim at the nursing home.
{0.SimFirstName} gained some Empathy and Social while talking to the elderly Sim at the nursing home.

{0.SimFirstName} didn't want to listen to any old-timey music, so instead {M0.he}{F0.she} blasted some of {M0.his}{F0.her} favorite music instead. The elderly Sim didn't seem to enjoy the music but {0.SimFirstName} got pretty pumped up.

To {0.SimFirstName}'s surprise, the elderly Sim sat down and busted out some songs on the piano. The songs were very nice, and the elderly Sim taught {0.SimFirstName} some things about playing the piano.

The elderly Sim started to play some old music on the stereo, but it seemed to be broken. {0.SimFirstName} tried to fix the stereo, but {M0.he}{F0.she} just kept making it worse. Finally, {M0.he}{F0.she} lost {M0.his}{F0.her} temper and tore the stereo to pieces. The elder looked really disappointed.
{0.SimFirstName} lost some Emotional Control from tearing apart the elder's stereo at the nursing home.
{0.SimName} gained some Manners and Piano Skill from playing piano with the elder in the Nursing Home.
{0.SimName} gained some Manners and Creativity Skill from playing piano with the elder in the Nursing Home.
{0.SimFirstName} lost some Manners but became Energized by playing some modern music for the elders.

{0.SimFirstName} politely asked the elder if they would like to listen to some modern music instead. The elders agreed and started nodding their heads to the beat. {0.SimFirstName} decided to bust out some dance moves and one of the elders joined in! Everyone had a great time.
{0.SimFirstName} gained some Manners and Social from dancing with the nursing home elders.
{0.SimFirstName} sat down with the elderly Sims and changed the channel to {M0.his}{F0.her} favorite TV show. The elders didn't seem too happy about this and grumbled through the entire show.

{0.SimFirstName} sat down with the elderly Sims and started asking them questions about their past. The elderly Sims seemed to enjoy reminiscing and sharing stories, and forgot all about their disagreement.
{0.SimFirstName} tried to interrupt the elders with some questions, but they looked incredibly offended that {M0.he}{F0.she} was butting into their conversation.
{0.SimName} lost some Manners from interrupting the elderly Sims' conversation at the Nursing Home.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution and Social for resolving the argument between the elder Sims.
{0.SimName} lost some Conflict Resolution and gained some Fun from watching TV with the nursing home elders.

{0.SimFirstName} started to flip through the channels when the TV stopped working! {0.SimFirstName} and the elderly Sims ended up working together to fix the TV and everyone forgot about the argument.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution and some Handiness from repairing the TV with the elder Sims.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution and some Mental from repairing the TV with the elder Sims.

{0.SimFirstName} found some clear tape and tried to make it look like the rose bush was still intact. It wasn't a very successful effort and the elders looked disappointed when they saw the mangled bush.

{0.SimFirstName} confessed to the elderly Sim about the damage {M0.he}{F0.she} caused to the bush. The elderly Sim wasn't mad at all and actually showed {0.SimFirstName} some gardening tips for next time!

When {0.SimFirstName} admitted {M0.his}{F0.her} mistake to the elderly Sim, the elder burst into tears: "That was my late wife's favorite rose bush." {0.SimFirstName} was so surprised by the elder's response that {M0.he}{F0.she} ran off without another word.
{0.SimName} lost some Empathy from running away from the upset elder at the nursing home.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility and Gardening skill from helping the elder fix the rose bush at the nursing home.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility and Mental skill from helping the elder fix the rose bush at the nursing home.
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility from trying to act like the rose bush wasn't ruined.

{0.SimFirstName} was trying to glue the bush back together when {M0.he}{F0.she} was caught by an elderly Sim. Luckily the elder had a pretty good sense of humor about it, and convinced {0.SimFirstName} to own up to {M0.his}{F0.her} mistake.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility from admitting {M0.his}{F0.her} gardening accident to the elderly Sim.
{0.SimFirstName} had a lot of fun chopping veggies and talking with the chef. {M0.He}{F0.She} also picked up a few cooking tips!

{0.SimFirstName} was trying to look busy when the chef approached {M0.him}{F0.her} and asked {M0.him}{F0.her} for help. {0.SimFirstName} agreed to help out of politeness. The chef seemed really grateful for the help!
{0.SimFirstName} passed on helping the chef and tried to find something easier to do, but the soup kitchen director stuck {M0.him}{F0.her} with washing dishes all evening.
{0.SimName} lost some Manners and Fun because {M0.he}{F0.she} didn't help the soup kitchen chef with the chopping.
{0.SimName} gained some Manners for being polite to the soup kitchen chef.

{0.SimFirstName} rudely grabbed some of the busy chef's ingredients and started chopping them up without asking. The chef was really angry that {0.SimFirstName} wasn't preparing them correctly and told {M0.him}{F0.her} to leave the kitchen.
{0.SimName} lost some Manners for chopping up the veggies without talking to the chef at the soup kitchen.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility and Cooking from helping the chef chop veggies.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility and Mental from helping the chef chop veggies.

{0.SimFirstName} explains the situation to the Sims in line and asks everyone to share with each other. The Sims are moved by {M0.his}{F0.her} words, and agree to get a little less, but everyone gets a bowl. It's a good feeling to see everyone come together to make sure that no single Sim goes hungry.

{0.SimFirstName} approaches the chef, and asks for some cabbage and onions to add to the pot to make up for the lack of meat. The chef find a bunch of extra veggies to add to the pot. This soup is even better than before!

{0.SimFirstName} starts grabbing random ingredients from the kitchen and throwing them in the soup. The chef is horrified when she catches {0.SimFirstName} putting all the food in the soup. The soup tastes terrible and there isn't enough food left to make any other dishes.
{0.SimName} lost some Manners for not asking the chef before grabbing random ingredients.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility for asking the chef for some extra ingredients for the soup.

{0.SimFirstName} tries to explain the situation to the Sims in line, but they are unmoved by {M0.his}{F0.her} words, and they rush the kitchen. The soup pot is knocked over in the process, and now everyone has to go hungry.
{0.SimName} lost some Conflict Resolution from failing to get the Sims at the soup kitchen to work together.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution from getting the Sims at the soup kitchen to share food.

{0.SimFirstName} decides to work the line. As each Sim gets a ladle-full of soup, {0.SimFirstName} makes sure to interact with each of them personally. A little joke here, a heartfelt comment there go a long way to ensuring the hall is filled with smiles.

{0.SimFirstName} heads right to the back and gets {M0.his}{F0.her} hands dirty. The other volunteers seem to really respect {M0.him}{F0.her} for jumping into the fray and not being afraid to get down and dirty.

{0.SimFirstName} heads right to the back and starts cleaning dishes. {M0.He}{F0.She} ignores the volunteer coordinator's directions for using the dishwasher. Before long the machine starts backing up and dishwater suds and bubbles start filling up the hallway!
{0.SimName} lost some Responsibility for ignoring the dishwasher directions and flooding the soup kitchen.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility for jumping in where needed at the soup kitchen.

{0.SimFirstName} decides to work the line. {M0.He}{F0.She} saunters up, kiss a few babies, take a few pictures, and hands out the soup. Other volunteers seem to resent how hard and thankless their jobs are by comparison. Perhaps next time {0.SimFirstName} will share the fun role.
{0.SimName} loses some Empathy for taking the good job for {M0.himself}{F0.herself} instead of sharing with the other volunteers.
{0.SimName} gains some Empathy for being kind to the soup kitchen patrons.

{0.SimFirstName} was able to balance giving an honest response without hurting the chef's feeling. The Chef compliments {0.SimFirstName} on catching the mistake and makes {M0.him}{F0.her} honorary Sous Chef for the day.
The compliment goes over well and {0.SimFirstName} wins the Chef's favor. {0.SimFirstName} sneaks some more ingredients into the soup while the Chef is not looking which cut down on the saltiness.

The salty soup goes over terribly with the patrons. The chef is overwhelmed with negative comments from Sims who got free soup. He directs his anger toward {0.SimFirstName} and chastises {M0.him}{F0.her} for not providing honest feedback.
{0.SimName} lost some Conflict Resolution for not giving honest feedback to the chef.
{0.SimName} gained some Manners for being so polite to the soup kitchen chef.

{0.SimFirstName} wasn't very tactful with {M0.his}{F0.her} criticism, and the Chef doesn't take the critique lightly. {0.SimFirstName} is thrown out of the kitchen and ends up restocking napkins for the rest of the event.
{0.SimName} lost some Conflict Resolution for lacking tact with {M0.his}{F0.her} feedback to the chef.
{0.SimName} gained some Conflict Resolution for giving the chef honest feedback.

The power company lost the bill payment in the mailroom and automatically shut off the power. {0.SimFirstName} keeps {M0.his}{F0.her} cool on the phone with the power company, and after a few minutes of negotiation, the problem is resolved and the power restored.

{0.SimFirstName} takes charge of the situation and rigs up a soup heating system with some candles, paper clips, bubble gum, and old serving trays. Everyone eats tasty warm soup and gets to eat by candlelight.

{0.SimFirstName} tries to balance soup pots over candles and fails. {M0.He}{F0.She} ends up tossing the soup pot against the wall in frustration, and soup spills everywhere. Everyone goes hungry and the volunteers are angry that they have to clean up the mess.
{0.SimName} lost some Emotional Control for tossing the soup pot in frustration.
{0.SimName} gained some Responsibility and Mental for {M0.his}{F0.her} ingenuity at the soup kitchen.

Your guest bathroom has never looked so neat and organized. Keep all the essentials nearby without cluttering up your sink and counter areas. But keep the TP close to hand; just to be safe.
Don't forget to sort your laundry to avoid weird coloring mishaps. You know what? Don't even worry about it. It's probably not a big deal either way.

You're not a real Dad unless you have 50 remotes to run your TV. And of course that will then necessitate a special holder for all those remotes. Voila! Stick this ugly thing next to your couch and welcome to Dadhood!

This is the perfect piece of furniture to help clean your room. And by "clean your room" we obviously mean shove all your belongings as quickly as possible into a piece of furniture; ANY piece of furniture. Because there is fun to be had and you need to get this lame cleaning chore done so you can get to it! High-five!

Some Sims say that my room looks like a clusterbomb went off. But I tell them it's not a mess, but an intricate evolving defense network. If the floor is constantly littered with clutter then no one can sneak up on me unannounced. And if the clutter constantly grows and changes then no intruders can memorize the pattern. So THAT is the reason my room has clutter. Oh, and I'm also really lazy.

This box is exploding with joy in the form of glue, scissors, glitter, tape, construction paper, all manner of pens, various googly eyes, and other assorted craft fare. No child can truly consider themselves a professional artist without one of these handy boxes.

This is undoubtedly the most beautiful, perfect vase in all the lands in all the worlds. It isn't the color. It's not the materials. It isn't the craftsmanship. It's the tiny hands that made it and the huge amount of love that was put into it that makes this definitively the best vase ever!
A charming ceramic reminder of academic excellence, given whenever the school district wants to celebrate a student. Supposedly, the bunny is named Stanley.

Bright and full of color, but not flavor. This is for decorative purposes only. We are not liable for any injuries incurred through ingestion of inedible materials. Consider yourself warned. Other than that, it's quite lovely and ready to bring charm to your home.
Ugh, c'mon sis! Your stuff is all over the bathroom. The clutter is driving me nuts and seriously grossing me out. Take your brushes and dryer and hairballs and get 'em out of sight! So nasty.

Put all your makeup away? Like, all of it? Who really has the time to actually carefully place every little item back in its proper place? How about just generally containing it on this tray? Yeah, I thought that sounded better too.
Oh wow. A collectible plate. To decorate. On the wall. A plate. You hang it up. And look at it. And... yes. Kids all over the world are jumping up and down in excitement. Truly breathtaking.

For scale, this breadbox is roughly the size of 1.25 breadboxes. For those across the lake it's the size of 17 semi-ripe bananas. Although we don't normally recommend storing bananas in your breadbox. Bread is actually the preferred carbohydrate storable unit. The more you know...
Also known as a Dish Rack. But we felt a more poetic title would help us move some extra units. It's all about volume in the cutthroat world of dish rack sales. Always be closing.
Rack of the Wood of the Dishes

Keep all your medication locked up safely and out of the kids' reach. Note: this doesn't defend against nosy house guests though. Fill the cabinet up with marbles before they arrive. When they open it up when they shouldn't? Now you caught 'em! HA!
We're all dorks for something so why not proudly display your interests for all to see? Show off that A+ paper, pin up those drawings, flex those crafts muscles!
When it's time to retire the old deck don't throw it away! Cherish those Skate memories forever by keeping them in a special place close to your heart - and on the wall.
The best thing about hanging strings of lights is that you only have to hang them up once! It's totally socially acceptable to leave them up all year round and never ever ever take them down!
The best thing about hanging strings of lights is that you only have to hang them up once! It's totally socially acceptable to leave them up all year round and never ever ever take them down!

Do you expect your shower curtain to define you as a person? Fear not; we got you fam. With curtains coming in a wide range of options you're sure to find the one that screams, "MY bathroom"! Assuming you put this in your bathroom of course. It would be kind of weird otherwise, but hey! We don't judge. You pay your Simoleons like anyone else and we don't ask any questions. Do you.
Xtreme Shower Tub with Customizable Curtain

This big, open sink offers easy access to kids and is perfect for washing up after a dirty play day outside. And there is nothing underneath the sink, because it's easier to clean that way and these kids get. dirt. everywhere. So anything that makes it easier to clean is a huge thumbs up.

This sink/cabinet combo unit was designed with families in mind. There is plenty of underneath storage and a wide overhanging sink counter to help avoid stains and assist in cleanup. The faucet features easy to manage handles convenient for small hands.
Single Pipe Sink with Wooden Cabinet
This versatile barstool fits many lifestyles and is very easy to clean. Also a breeze to assemble and will last for years! Tools come included so what's to lose? Pick up a set now!
Ergonomic design provides Sims with added support and comfort. Available in several bright, bold colors to ensure your desk is the life of the party.

This solid, straightforward chair is made of wood and offers a no frills seating experience. But, the back is not solid and just a frame. So (unlike lame parents) you never have to tell this chair to get off your back.
Get Off My Back Dining Chair
Every kid has gone to a grandparent's or other elder's house and seen chairs like these around their dining table. Sturdy, dependable, classic. There's a reason why these remain so popular!
Now this is a comfortable chair! Perfect for sitting and relaxing in ultimate style and comfort. This chair would even make an alert security guard sleepy in an instant.

This rustic couch is solid and well made. Quality aged wood gives this piece weight, but it is sure built to last. It also sits slightly off the ground; perfect to allow easy cleaning of pet hair and assorted kids droppings.

Some styles never go out of style. This is one of them. Folks seem to love the classic look of the early models. Of course the magic of modern technology has made these units even more reliable and desirable.
This large table is great for big families to rally around and hang together! Read, do your homework, annoy the ever living heck out of your sibling. You know, good old fashioned family fun!

I'm such a square? No, YOU'RE such a square! Oh... the table. Of course. We're talking about the name of the table. Sorry, these kids are driving me nuts with all their bickering. Yeah, it's a square table all right. Have at it.

What's "modern antique"? Good question. It's modern, but we want to make it seem cooler so we can charge a little extra. It's kind of like a restaurant saying they use Fresh Frozen food. ("It was fresh when we froze it!") Same mentality applies here. Smart marketing, huh?

With lots of built-in storage, this table is the perfect analogy for the busy family on the go. It appears clean and organized, but just under the surface is a crazy array of hand towels and combs and tubes and... stuff!

Who doesn't like a little light reading material before bed? Whether you're browsing the latest gossip rags, finishing your homework, or baring your soul in your Journal, this is always within arm's reach to accept you... and your stuff.

The Night Owl Toy Night Light can be played with and used as a night light! The kiddos may wake up happy when it's on, but for extra precautions, the light is turned off when being played with. Wouldn't want kids electrocuting themselves, right?
This large window still manages to maintain a slim frame while allowing plenty of open space for grand views. Perfect in any living room that wants to let the light in!
The hungry masses are lined up and ready to eat. Lend a hand, grab a ladle, and help dish it out!
Go to your local nursing home spend some time brightening an elderly Sim's day!
Go and clean up your local beach! Then when you go there later on, it won't be so messy!
Try your hand at volunteering at a bake sale. Don't forget to bring the cookies!
Go on a Walk to Fight Disease which raises funds for medical research to find a cure.

Have a Child with 3 Positive Character Value Traits

Have any household Toddler, Child, or Teen receive any 3 positive traits from Character Values upon aging up to a Young Adult. The possible traits include Good Manners, Responsible, Mediator, Compassionate, or Emotional Control.

Have any household Toddler, Child, or Teen reach the maximum for any Character Value. Certain behaviors will gain or lose Character Values, and parents can also influence how their offspring behave. They can have a maximum value either positively or negatively.

Sims can positively increase their Conflict Resolution by being apologetic or reconciling arguments. Parents can Teach to Say Sorry as well. Trying to Help Fix Bad Relationships will also increase Conflict Resolution.\n\nDeclaring enemies or despising Sims can negatively impact Conflict Resolution, as well as fighting or arguing.

Sims who can redirect their negative emotions can build Emotional Control. They can do several winding down interactions on radios and instruments, or jog to clear their mind.

Having an emotional breakdown, shoving, or biting will negatively impact Emotional Control. Destroying dollhouses or School Project Boxes will also decrease this value.

Sims can increase their Empathy by Volunteering as a family or choosing socials that help others deal with negative moods. Children can play with their doctor playset as well.

Being mean, yelling at another Sim, trolling on the computer, or hitting stuffed animals will decrease Empathy.

Manners values can increase by friendly introductions, setting the table, cleaning up dishes, or giving compliments. Parents can also teach their kids to say please and thank you.

Negative Manners are earned by burping or farting, swearing, and rude introductions. Toddlers taking their clothes off in front of strangers is also bad manners.

Taking out trash, brushing teeth, and cleaning up toys from the toy box will also have a positive impact.\n\nDoing poorly in school, breaking curfew, or disobeying grounding will negatively impact Responsibility. Toddlers and Children making a mess will decrease Responsibility, as will Teens quitting their job.

A skilled parent knows when to influence, when to encourage, and when to discipline children. They know the best way to clean a kid up and how to solve their needs. \n\nParenting skill is built by caring for children, talking to other parents, and researching on the computer. Increasing this skill will unlock new ways to parent children and solve their motives.
Gives bonus Character Value scoring when near Toddlers, Children, or Teens.
Be the Bear! This child will accept nothing less than dressing as an amazing fruit-themed ruler of the forest. It will feel unbearable to wear any other outfits.

This Sim feels safest when interacting with their caregiver. There is no reason to interact with others when you have such an amazing person in your life. Forcing this Sim to interact with others will stress them out.
This teen has become distant. Being near and interacting with family has started to stress them out. The world just doesn't understand them.
This Sim is letting the world hear {M0.his}{F0.her} voice! This Sim yells, makes noise on instruments, and will listen to music as loud as possible. Earplugs are advised for other family members.
It is time to be Mean just because. This Sim is feeling nasty and will relish the chance to be Mean to other Sims.
It's good to be a Picky Eater. Keep all those nasty culinary concoctions away from the Sim. They will prefer to eat their favorite Quick Meal.
Growing up means rebelling against the old fuddy duddy's rules. This Sim will argue with their parents more often, swear, and procrastinate when doing homework.
Argumentative Sims don't always start conversations on the right foot with Sims they don't like. Successfully apologizing is harder and they do try to assert their correctness more often than not.
Sims with Bad Manners can try to be Friendly, but will always fail using certain socials. They will often use gross manners, swear a lot, and never want to do the dishes.
Compassionate Sims can help other Sims relieve their negative emotions. They can also empathize with them by Sharing Emotional Burdens. However, these Sims get stressed when being Mean.

Sims who have the Emotional Control Trait can relieve negative moods by jogging, listening to certain music, blogging on the computer, or playing an instrument. In general, their negative emotions will go away faster than other Sims.

Sims with Good Manners won't want to do any gross manners interactions, at least not in front of anyone. They also have a new Polite Introduction and can gain friendly relationships faster. Good Mannered Sims can also Offer Gratitude to the Host of a house they are visiting.
Irresponsible Sims are uncomfortable at work, but ignoring bills and slacking off brings them joy. They may also encounter new situations when at work.
Mediator Sims have a higher chance at successfully apologizing to other Sims and can Mediate the Forums. They can also mend differences with Sims they have not been friendly with for a long time.
Responsible Sims perform better at their jobs and can teach children and teens how to be responsible.
Sims with Uncontrolled Emotions won't be able to relieve their negative emotions as fast as other Sims. When they have strong negative emotions, they may have an emotional meltdown.

Insensitive Sims are able to Question other Sims' negative emotions. They can also Instigate other Sims. Insensitive Sims will have a higher chance of failing socially when talking to Sims with bad emotions.

When a Teen ages up to Young Adult their Character Values progress will be converted into traits. These traits will impact the Sim's day-to-day life. For example, a Sim that gets the Responsible Trait will do better at their job, working hard without the stress, and automatically complete their Daily Task. It pays to have a good foundation!

Character Values determine a Sim's ability to adapt and behave effectively in everyday life. There are 5 Character Values that can be positive or negative: Manners, Responsibility, Conflict Resolution, Empathy, and Emotional Control. Toddlers, Children, and Teens can gain or lose values based on their actions and how their parents participate in these behaviors.\n\nOnce a Sim ages up to a Young Adult, their Character Values are locked in, and they will receive a unique Trait depending where their Character Values lie.

Children and Teens can see their Character Values progress in the Simology panel. Each of the 5 values can be viewed here.

Once a value has reached the dark ends of the meter, the Sim is in range to receive a Trait when they age up. The Sim can still fall out of range until they age up to a young adult.

Hover over each Character Value to view ways you can influence the value.

Depending on the traits the Sim starts with, they may have some Character Values to begin with. For example, a Sim with the Slob trait will start with a little bit of negative Manners. But Sims can still change their Manners values through their actions, such as cleaning up dishes. They won't be stuck in the negative as long as their actions speak louder than their heart!

Five Character Values can be influenced by a Sim's behavior:\n
  • Manners
  • Responsibility
  • Conflict Resolution
  • Empathy
  • Emotional Control
\nOnly Toddlers, Children, and Teens can have their Character Values influenced.

Behaviors that positively contribute to Responsibility include:
  • Having the Perfectionist Trait
  • Completing a School Project
  • Doing Homework
  • Getting Good Grades
  • Making a Sack Lunch
  • Teens performing well at their part-time job
  • Taking out the trash
  • Brushing Teeth
  • Repairing broken objects
  • Cleaning up toys from the Toybox
  • Cleaning up a mess
\nBehaviors that negatively contribute to Responsibility include:
  • Having the Childish Trait
  • Getting bad grades
  • Missing school or part-time job
  • Quitting part-time job
  • Making a Mess
  • Playing in Toilet
  • Disobeying Grounding
  • Breaking curfew

Behaviors that positively contribute to Emotional Control:
  • Having the Self-Assured Trait
  • Writing in Journal
  • Jog to Clear Mind when in a Negative Mood
  • Listen to Classical to Wind Down when in a Negative Mood
  • Playing Instruments with Emotion when in a Negative Mood
  • Play with Emotion when in a Negative Mood
  • Blogging About Feelings when in a Negative Mood
\nBehaviors that negatively contribute to Emotional Control:
  • Having the Jealous or Insane Trait
  • Having an Emotional Breakdown
  • Shoving or biting another Sim
  • Hitting another Sim
  • Smashing a dollhouse
  • Destroying a School Project

Behaviors that positively contribute to Empathy include:
  • Having the Good Trait
  • Volunteering as a Family
  • Playing with the Doctor Playset
  • Asking about Negative Moods
  • Calm Down, Cheer Up, or Console about Death socials
\nBehaviors that negatively contribute to Empathy include:
  • Having the Mean or Evil Trait
  • Mean socials
  • Yelling at another Sim
  • Trolling on the Computer
  • Hitting a Stuffed Animal
  • Laugh at Embarrassment or Mock Sadness socials
  • Belittle Anger, Downplay Stress, or Scoff at Discomfort socials

Behaviors that positively contribute to Manners include:
  • Having the Neat Trait
  • Parents Teaching to Say Please and Thank You
  • Friendly Introductions
  • Setting the Table
  • Cleaning up dishes
  • Giving Compliments
\nBehaviors that negatively contribute to Manners include:
  • Having the Slob Trait
  • Belching and Farting
  • Swearing
  • Rude Introductions
  • Toddlers taking off clothes around Strangers

Behaviors that positively contribute to Conflict Resolution:
  • Having the Outgoing Trait
  • Reconciling after Arguing
  • Apologizing after a Negative Interaction
  • Beg for Forgiveness, Find Common Ground, or Try to Chat socials
  • Parents Teaching to Say Sorry
  • Make Peace after Fight social
  • Try to Fix Bad Relationship
\nBehaviors that negatively contribute to Conflict Resolution:
  • Having the Hot Headed Trait
  • Declaring an enemy
  • Having a Despised relationship
  • Fighting other Sims
  • Getting into Arguments

Children often need a firm parent to help shape them into model citizens. They need to be taught that making a mess isn't acceptable. Parents can encourage or discourage their positive and negative behavior.\n\nDiscouragement comes in a variety of severities. Parents could gently ask a child not to do something, give the child a firm talking to, or lose it and yell at the child to stop.

A child won't always react to discipline in the same way. It is important to pay attention to the reaction a child gives. Sometimes they will listen willingly, sometimes they will listen unwillingly, and sometimes they will outright reject the disciplinary action.
Discipline will increase or decrease key character values. Those character values will also influence how children respond to discipline and grounding rules.

When a child really misbehaves the only recourse can be Grounding. The parent chooses which of the child's favorite activities to Ground them from. All groundings last for one day. Responsible children wouldn't dare break a grounding rule. Less responsible children may try to get away with a lot more. A child caught breaking grounding rules can be grounded again.

Sims can raise their Parenting Skill by researching on the computer or by reading skill books. The best way to improve is actual parenting. In fact, the only way to reach the top levels of Parenting Skill is by practicing parenting skills. Work with children to encourage good behavior and discourage poor behavior. A caregiver solving a child's needs using the parenting socials will learn from that experience.

Learning moments happen all the time for children. It is up to parents to decide what behavior to encourage or discourage. Is the child making a mess? Choose to have a calm discussion on appropriate behavior or take a more forceful approach and yell at them to stop.
All adults can now learn the Parenting Skill. This skill is vital for any Sim looking to raise happy and well behaved children.

As a parent, a Sim will also feel the need to guide children through their daily routines. Parents can take a soft approach and try to influence their children to do things like clean dishes or go to bed. Some more stubborn children will need a more direct approach. Parents can give the child no option and force them to do their chores.

A parent's job isn't just about directing a child's behavior. Skilled parents will also help their children out by quickly solving their needs. The caregiver can influence the child to get a quick snack to hold off hunger. Other times they can tell the child to dust themselves off to quickly clean up.

A challenge with Babies is that their communication skills are just sub-par. A great parent will pick up on non-verbal cues and can determine what the baby needs. Knowing when a baby is hungry vs. sleepy could save many needless hours of crying.
